channel.title: Command Customization
channel.description: In my source, how can I add my own command? I know that I'd have to code it and if anything copy+paste. Like, copy+paste the ::char command, but where would I copy+paste it to?

item.title: Command Customization
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“NeighFox, post:10, topic:506568”]I just figured out that they are seperated by } as you posted, thanks a lot though!

Another thing, from my last topic:

Whenever I edit a .java file, exit the console, save the java file and restart the changes do not apply to the server but still save in the .java file. What is the problem?

For example, I changed the amount of health a food replenishes and it doesn’t overwrite on the server, but it saves in the .java.

I really, really don’t know what the problem is.[/quote]
Have you ever compiled the server…?

Read full topic

item.title: Command Customization
item.dc:creator: @NeighFox NeighFox
item.description:
@NeighFox wrote:

I just figured out that they are seperated by } as you posted, thanks a lot though!

Another thing, from my last topic:

[quote=“NeighFox, post:1, topic:506562”]Whenever I edit a .java file, exit the console, save the java file and restart the changes do not apply to the server but still save in the .java file. What is the problem?

For example, I changed the amount of health a food replenishes and it doesn’t overwrite on the server, but it saves in the .java.[/quote]

I really, really don’t know what the problem is.

Read full topic

item.title: Command Customization
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Get an IDE or Notepad++. They give syntax highlights and code hinting. So you can see where one command ends and another begins.

Read full topic

item.title: Command Customization
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’m assuming your commands.java is a mess.
But, } closing brackets separate commands.

Read full topic

item.title: Command Customization
item.dc:creator: @NeighFox NeighFox
item.description:
@NeighFox wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:506568”][quote author=NeighFox link=topic=624800.msg4254706#msg4254706 date=1362531947]
I’m using http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,624195.0.html as the source.
[/quote]
That’s 317 PI. You’ll want to remember that.
If I remember correctly. It should be in src>server>model>players>packets>Commands.java[/quote]

Thanks so much!
But one last thing, how do I separate commands? When I’m looking at this it is just a giant list of commands and it’s confusing and I just can’t figure out what the coders have done to separate commands.

Read full topic

item.title: Command Customization

NeighFox:

I’m using http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,624195.0.html as the source.

That’s 317 PI. You’ll want to remember that.
If I remember correctly. It should be in src>server>model>players>packets>Commands.java

item.title: Command Customization
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

NeighFox:

I mean the actual java code that I get off of google. Where is the location that I will be pasting the code into?

Depends on your source and revision.
Are you using 317, 474, 508, 525, 667, 718, 742, etc?
and what source? 317’s biggest are PI and delta…
718+ is matrix and rune-evo (I think)
The rest I don’t really know

Read full topic
